column2: git add {file name} or git add {file name} {file name} or git add . - adds all untracked files
represent the changes that will be committed next time

column1: View what changed before adding to stage

column2: git checkout -b NAME_OF_BRANCH, -b - move to the new branch (All code on the branch you were on when you created the new branch will automatically be included in the new branch code)
git merge {name of branch} (the branch that needs to be merged with the current branch)

git remote add {NAME_OF_REMOTE} {URL_FOR_REPOSITORY}
Example: git remote add webapps https://github.com/impulset/webapps.git

git push {NAME_OF_REMOTE} {NAME_OF_BRANCH} Example: git push webapps master 
flag -u sets the name of remote and the branch as default and we can do only git push

column1: See where remote pointing to locally
